intro: Calyptocarpus bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia calyptocarp, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine pubescence. The fruit is a capsule that encloses small, dry seeds, typical of the Malvaceae family.
